title.rendered: Rishabh Pant and Dinesh Karthik can be accommodated in the playing XI If Hardik Pandya is the fifth bowler: Sunil Gavaskar

content.rendered:
Former cricketer Sunil Gavaskar feels India can accommodate both wicketkeepers-Dinesh Karthik and Rishabh Pant in the playing XI by using Hardik Pandya as the fifth bowling option in the T20 World Cup in Australia. Karthik and Pant both have been fixtured in the 15-member Indian squad for the multinational tournament, and now vying for a spot in the XI for their first clash against Pakistan at Melbourne Cricket Ground in Melbourne on Sunday, October 23.

The 73-year-old Commentator has suggested an idea for both star wicketkeeper batters. It’s just that maybe, If the Indian think tank decides to go with six bowlers, with Hardik Pandya being the sixth bowler, then there would be no chance for Pant, and if Selectors and Rohit Sharma try to go with Pandya as a fifth bowler, then Pant and Karthik both may be a chance to be in playing XI.

Sunil Gavaskar

Earlier, Another Former India cricketer Suresh Raina said having a left-handed middle-order batter team India can perform better in the ongoing tournament. He also heaped praise on Rishabh Pant and said that the 25-year-old wicketkeeper batter would be the best option as a left-handed middle-order batter for India when Ravindra Jadeja is missing due to injury.

Read also:Millions may miss the mega T20 encounter at Melbourne of India and Pakistan due to rain possibility
